pattern.name: sw_management
pattern.description: Package management using directly the native libraries. This is a lightweight alternative to the ZENworks Linux Management tools for local systems. This pattern provides a graphical update application and a command line tool.

pattern.name: laptop
pattern.description: Tools designed specifically for use with laptop computers.

pattern.name: gateway_server
pattern.description: Set up a proxy, firewall, and gateway server. Also provide a virtual private network (VPN) gateway.

pattern.name: devel_kde
pattern.description: Development for the KDE Desktop

pattern.name: devel_java
pattern.description: Tools and libraries for software development using the Java programming language.

pattern.name: zmd_x11
pattern.description: ZENworks Linux Management - Graphical Tools

pattern.name: zmd
pattern.description: Novell ZENworks Linux Management makes it easy to embrace and extend Linux within your existing environment. The complete functionality is only available in a ZENworks Linux Management server controlled environment. ZENworks Linux management allows remote and local management of clients. The package management features are usefull for every system. This pattern provides a graphical update application, a command line tool and a system daemon.

pattern.name: gnome_basis
pattern.description: Basis packages for GNOME Desktop Environment

pattern.name: devel_rpm_build
pattern.description: Minimal set of tools and libraries for building packages using the RPM package manager.

pattern.name: devel_mono
pattern.description: Tools and libraries for software development using .NET on Linux.

pattern.name: devel_basis
pattern.description: Minimal set of tools for compiling and linking applications.

pattern.name: base
pattern.description: This is the base openSUSE runtime system.

pattern.name: print_server
pattern.description: Set up a print server to host print queues so that they may be accessed by other computers on the same network, including machines running Microsoft Windows operating systems. The print server may accept print jobs from client computers and direct them to locally attached printers or to network printers. lpd, cups, and smb print servers and queues are supported.

pattern.name: gnome_ide
pattern.description: Development under GNOME

pattern.name: gnome
pattern.description: The GNOME desktop environment is an intuitive and attractive desktop for users. The GNOME development platform is an extensive framework for building applications that integrate into the rest of the desktop.

pattern.name: directory_server
pattern.description: Set up a directory server with OpenLDAP and Kerberos. The Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) is used to access online directory services. It runs directly over TCP and can be used to access a stand-alone LDAP directory service or to access a directory service that has an X.500 back-end.

pattern.name: devel_perl
pattern.description: Tools and libraries for software development using the Perl programming language.

pattern.name: devel_kernel
pattern.description: Tools for Linux Kernel development.

pattern.name: xen_server
pattern.description: Set up a server to configure, manage, and monitor virtual machines on a single physical machine. Includes: * XEN virtual machine monitor * XEN virtual machine monitor tools and documentation * XEN-adapted Linux kernel for host server * YaST modules to install and configure virtual systems

pattern.name: non_oss
pattern.description: Packages that are proprietary and not under an open soure license.

pattern.name: misc_server
pattern.description: Miscelleaneous Server

pattern.name: games
pattern.description: Games

pattern.name: sw_management_x11
pattern.description: Package Management - Graphical Tools

pattern.name: network_admin
pattern.description: Tools for network administrators to debug the network.

pattern.name: gnome_games
pattern.description: GNOME Games

pattern.name: devel_rails
pattern.description: Tools and libraries for software development using the Ruby on Rails framework.

pattern.name: apparmor
pattern.description: Novell AppArmor is an open source Linux application security framework that provides mandatory access control for programs, protecting against the exploitation of software flaws and compromised systems. AppArmor includes everything you need to provide effective containment for programs (including those that run as root) to thwart attempted exploits and even zero-day attacks. AppArmor offers an advanced tool set that largely automates the development of per-program application security so that no new expertise is required.

pattern.name: x11
pattern.description: In continuous use for over 20 years, the X Window System provides the only standard platform-independent networked graphical window system bridging the heterogeneous platforms in today's enterprise: from network servers to desktops, thin clients, laptops, and handhelds, independent of operating system and hardware.

pattern.name: lamp_server
pattern.description: Set up a Web server that is able to serve static, dynamic, and interactive content (like a Web shop). It is based on the Apache HTTP Server, the database management system MySQL, and a scripting language such as PHP, Python, Ruby on Rails, or Perl.

pattern.name: imaging
pattern.description: Handling of digital photos and graphics

pattern.name: devel_qt4
pattern.description: Tools and libraries for software development using Qt 4, the latest version of the Qt toolkit. Note that the KDE desktop and Qt applications shipping with openSUSE use Qt 3.

pattern.name: devel_python
pattern.description: Tools and libraries for software development using the Python programming language.

pattern.name: mail_server
pattern.description: Set up electronic mail and message services to handle e-mail, mailing, and news lists. It can also set up a virus scanner to scan messages at the server level.

pattern.name: kde_basis
pattern.description: Basis packages for KDE Desktop Environment

pattern.name: fonts
pattern.description: Fonts.

pattern.name: xfce
pattern.description: Xfce is a lightweight desktop environment for various *NIX systems. Designed for productivity, it loads and executes applications fast, while conserving system resources.

pattern.name: kde_imaging
pattern.description: Handling of digital photos and graphics

pattern.name: kde
pattern.description: KDE is a powerful free software graphical desktop environment for Linux workstations. It combines ease of use, contemporary functionality, and outstanding graphical design with the technology of the Linux operating system.

pattern.name: devel_yast
pattern.description: Tools and libraries for developing modules for YaST, the setup and configuration tool for openSUSE.

pattern.name: default
pattern.description: This is the default system for this product.

pattern.name: xml
pattern.description: Tools to author manuals and create pdfs using XML and LaTeX.

pattern.name: kde_laptop
pattern.description: KDE Tools designed specifically for use with laptop computers.

pattern.name: kde_ide
pattern.description: Development under KDE

pattern.name: file_server
pattern.description: Set up a file server to host files so that they may be accessed or retrieved by other computers on the same network, including machines running Microsoft Windows operating systems. The file server can be set up to authenticate against Microsoft Windows domain controllers or to act as a domain controller. Files and directories can be shared with FTP, SMB, and NFS protocols.

pattern.name: devel_web
pattern.description: Tools and libraries for web application development.

pattern.name: console
pattern.description: Applications usefull for people using the console and no graphical desktop environment.

pattern.name: remote_desktop
pattern.description: Tools to access a remote desktop.

pattern.name: kde_games
pattern.description: KDE Games

pattern.name: dhcp_dns_server
pattern.description: Set up the server for the Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) that provides configuration parameters to client computers to integrate them into a network. Also provide Domain Name System (DNS) services to deliver information associated with domain names, in particular, the IP address.

pattern.name: devel_ide
pattern.description: Integrated Development Environments

pattern.name: yast2_basis
pattern.description: Essential YaST System Administration

pattern.name: non_oss_java
pattern.description: Proprietary Java Packages.

pattern.name: gnome_laptop
pattern.description: GNOME Tools designed specifically for use with laptop computers.

pattern.name: gnome_imaging
pattern.description: Handling of digital photos and graphics

pattern.name: devel_ruby
pattern.description: Tools and libraries for software development using the Ruby programming language.

pattern.name: devel_gnome
pattern.description: Development for the GNOME Desktop

pattern.name: devel_C_C++
pattern.description: Tools and libraries for software development using C/C++ and other derivates of the C programming language.
